access: Make yourself at home!  You're free to use our kitchen, fridge, washer, dryer, ironing board, WiFi, and any of the guitars and other instruments lying around!
description:
A cozy, private bedroom with a full size bed in the hippest neighborhood of Chicago conveniently located right by the blue line train that will take you everywhere you want to go!

Location, location, location!  
-1/2 block to the "606" walking trail
-Logan Square restaurants, shops, and nightlife
-10 min walk to the "el" with direct transportation to:
- O'hare airport
- Millenium Park
- Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum & Planetarium
- The Willis/Sears Tower Skydeck
- Art Institute
- Mag Mile

You'll get a private bedroom. The bedroom is small, but has everything you need for a good night's sleep. Each bedroom has a lock with a key to keep your belongings secure.  The main living areas and bathroom may be shared with other guests who are staying in one of the other bedrooms.

Make yourself at home!  You're free to use our kitchen, fridge, washer, dryer, ironing board, WiFi, and any of the guitars and other instruments lying around!

LOGAN SQUARE — Described as the "Midwest headquarters of hip," Logan Square has been named one of the 15 "hottest urban retail markets across North America."

RESTAURANTS:
- Revolution Brewing (lively, chef-driven pub fair) 
-Boiler Room (hippest pizza place in town with lots of craft beer, and a great beer garden) 
-Lula Cafe (Inventive, market-driven food in a casual, funky space that hosts an especially popular brunch)
-Reno (Wood-fired pizza, bagels & pasta in a casual, loftlike space with a bar for pastries & alcohol) 
-Longman and Eagle (modern farm-to-table fine dining with a great whiskey/cocktail selection)
-Donkey Table Stick (upscale comfort fare and drinks in a rustic setting) 
-The Radler (wursts and hearty German eats, plus plenty of beers, in a brick walled space covered in street art) 
-Cozy Corner (classic diner serving up hearty breakfast/lunch right next to the train stop) - 0.4
-Margies Candies (Open for more than 90 years, this vintage candy and ice cream shop allegedly played host to a Beatles ice cream sundae party in 1965) 
-Kuma's Corner (Heavy metal themed burger place. I like the "Slayer") 
Fat Rice 
BARS:
-Emporium (plenty of pool tables, pinball, and air hockey) 
-Spilt Milk (A 1920s pharmacy with an old-school look sets the stage for crafty takes on classic cocktails) 
-Coles (Live music, comedy & open-mike nights are showcased at this laid-back neighborhood dive) 
-The Owl (My favorite, late bar, good coctails, craft beer, hipster dance party)
Slippery Slope (dance club downstairs, with a quiet and dimly lit craft cocktail bar upstairs) 
Scofflaw (national recognized, award-winning craft cocktail bar with lots of cozy nooks and comfortable seating) 

COFFEE:
Bang Bang Pie
Gaslight Roasters 
Mustache Cafe 

MUSIC:
-Concord Music Hall (top acts from rock to EDM, 1500 capacity venue) - 0.5mi
-Township (smaller hipster venue) - 0.4mi
-The Whistler (trendy yet laid back bar featuring live music/DJ's nightly with no cover) - 0.5mi
-Rosa's Lounge (classic neighborhood club that features the best is Blues from across the country) - 1.6mi


RECREATION:
Palmer Square Park (7 acre park featuring a gravel, 1/2 mile running track around its perimeter) - 0.7mi
606 Trail (a 2.7 mile elevated multi-use trail and park that connects neighborhood after neighborhood in the heart of Chicago) - 0.8mi
Fireside Bowl (Fireside Bowl is a bowling alley and was a music venue known for for being thee punk rock mecca of the late 90s) - 0.1mi

The Blue Line "el" train is only .4 miles away giving you easy access to the entire city, especially all the hip spots which tend to be along the blue line!  Plus it's a straight shot to O'hare Airport.  If you're renting a car, street parking is free and it's typically easy.

-The common areas, including the bathroom, may be shared with other guests.
-We keep the cost low because of teamwork. We will ask you to make the bed before leaving.
-The bedroom is small and cozy, but has everything you need for a good night's sleep.

You should stay here if:
-you think meeting new people is cool
-you get that you’ll be sharing the common areas with other guests(cool new people)
- you believe in teamwork: making the bed
-you’re on a budget 
-you don’t need much space

You should NOT stay here if:
-you’re looking for a five star hotel with room service and a mini bar
-you need housekeeping on standby 24-hours per day
-you’re  not a fan of teamwork, you prefer to be waited on
house_rules:
-Guests must read and understand the detailed welcome message and self check in instructions on the Airbnb app. 

-Leave the apartment at least as nice as it was when you arrived.  As the boyscouts say, "try to leave this world a little better than you found it."  This is a more self sufficient Airbnb than many (which is why it is so affordable!) so teamwork is required.  You are expected to clean up after yourself and help contribute to keeping the place clean.  

-Please make the bed with the clean sheets provided before you check out.  Leave your sheets and towels in the hamper.  

-Default check in is 3pm, checkout at 12pm noon.  We are flexible and can easily accommodate early check in and late checkout upon request.

-Shoes off at the door

-Make sure all dishes are washed and put away before checkout

-No unregistered guests are allowed on the property without approval (and obviously no parties!)

-No eating or drinking within the bedrooms. 

-Smoking is not allowed in the property.  If you smoke outside the property, cigarette butts must be discarded in the bucket provided or into your own receptacle.  Do not leave cigarette butts on the ground.
neighborhood_overview:
LOGAN SQUARE — Described as the "Midwest headquarters of hip," Logan Square has been named one of the 15 "hottest urban retail markets across North America."

RESTAURANTS:
- Revolution Brewing (lively, chef-driven pub fair) 
-Boiler Room (hippest pizza place in town with lots of craft beer, and a great beer garden) 
-Lula Cafe (Inventive, market-driven food in a casual, funky space that hosts an especially popular brunch)
-Reno (Wood-fired pizza, bagels & pasta in a casual, loftlike space with a bar for pastries & alcohol) 
-Longman and Eagle (modern farm-to-table fine dining with a great whiskey/cocktail selection)
-Donkey Table Stick (upscale comfort fare and drinks in a rustic setting) 
-The Radler (wursts and hearty German eats, plus plenty of beers, in a brick walled space covered in street art) 
-Cozy Corner (classic diner serving up hearty breakfast/lunch right next to the train stop) - 0.4
-Margies Candies (Open for more than 90 years, this vintage candy and ice cream shop allegedly played host to a Beatles ice cream sundae party in 1965) 
-Kuma's Corner (Heavy metal themed burger place. I like the "Slayer") 
Fat Rice 
BARS:
-Emporium (plenty of pool tables, pinball, and air hockey) 
-Spilt Milk (A 1920s pharmacy with an old-school look sets the stage for crafty takes on classic cocktails) 
-Coles (Live music, comedy & open-mike nights are showcased at this laid-back neighborhood dive) 
-The Owl (My favorite, late bar, good coctails, craft beer, hipster dance party)
Slippery Slope (dance club downstairs, with a quiet and dimly lit craft cocktail bar upstairs) 
Scofflaw (national recognized, award-winning craft cocktail bar with lots of cozy nooks and comfortable seating) 

COFFEE:
Bang Bang Pie
Gaslight Roasters 
Mustache Cafe 

MUSIC:
-Concord Music Hall (top acts from rock to EDM, 1500 capacity venue) - 0.5mi
-Township (smaller hipster venue) - 0.4mi
-The Whistler (trendy yet laid back bar featuring live music/DJ's nightly with no cover) - 0.5mi
-Rosa's Lounge (classic neighborhood club that features the best is Blues from across the country) - 1.6mi


RECREATION:
Palmer Square Park (7 acre park featuring a gravel, 1/2 mile running track around its perimeter) - 0.7mi
606 Trail (a 2.7 mile elevated multi-use trail and park that connects neighborhood after neighborhood in the heart of Chicago) - 0.8mi
Fireside Bowl (Fireside Bowl is a bowling alley and was a music venue known for for being thee punk rock mecca of the late 90s) - 0.1mi

summary:
A cozy, private bedroom with a full size bed in the hippest neighborhood of Chicago conveniently located right by the blue line train that will take you everywhere you want to go!

Location, location, location!  
-1/2 block to the "606" walking trail
-Logan Square restaurants, shops, and nightlife
-10 min walk to the "el" with direct transportation to:
- O'hare airport
- Millenium Park
- Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum & Planetarium
- The Willis/Sears Tower Skydeck
- Art Institute
- Mag Mile

access: First of all, Welcome! Feel free to use the living room in front of the bedroom. Coffee or tea anytime, self serve. I have hair dryer, shampoo, razors and tooth brushes if you need. Use the kitchen if you like, but tidy up after. PLEASE DON'T COOK MEAT HERE.
description:
Welcome to my home. I offer a clean place to rest your head, and bathe, in an alternative to a sterile expensive hotel. There are three guest rooms total.
You get a Private Room in a renovated Victorian 2 flat. Trees and gardens surround this urban diverse neighborhood. Free parking, CTA bus at the front door. Real bed, shared full bath, individual air con unit, or heat unit as well as central heat. West of downtown by 10 minutes drive, 3 miles, or 20 min by public transit. By United Center.

The building stands alone with community gardens all around. Light comes in from all directions here on the second floor. I have the whole floor! Warm homey Victorian 2 flat, dark wood floors and clean new fixtures. Free parking.
I have two other guest rooms. I mentioned "smoking allowed" but only outdoors please, the apartment is smoke free.

First of all, Welcome! Feel free to use the living room in front of the bedroom. Coffee or tea anytime, self serve. I have hair dryer, shampoo, razors and tooth brushes if you need. Use the kitchen if you like, but tidy up after. PLEASE DON'T COOK MEAT HERE.

I can help you find stuff if you like, navigate transportation if needed. We can chat or not, whatever your style is.

When choosing and rating my location, please understand this about my neighborhood: it is not an upscale neighborhood, but my street is very nice with a few run down looking places in the mix. I see myself as part of the solution. I love it here because it is not crowded, and it is so close to downtown. I walk around at night, but I am sensible about it.
The train station area is crummy looking, let's admit it. Don't judge me or my street by that! most train stations are a little run down.
My area is adjacent to so much. Garfield Park Conservatory is near, United Center, Humboldt Park, Ukrainian Village are about a mile or so away. There are great spots to eat all along Chicago Avenue, California and Division both have lots of neighborhood eateries and bars, funky boutiques. Logan Square is a short ride away, with all it's hot spots. And of course access to downtown with all it's high end shopping, attractions, and the Lake! is just east of me easily accessible by train. Save your parking money for shopping eating and having fun!

CTA Route 94 South California stops at the front door. 
To the south 2 stops, it goes right to the Green Line train, at the California station. 
To the north 2 stops, it connects to CTA Bus Route 66 Chicago Ave bus and the 52 North California bus route. Very easy. 
Uber and Lyft both come here happily, and I have a good relationship with the drivers that I get often. 
There is a bike rental (Divvy) right by the California train stop, and one a block north of me at a green center. I have my own bike so I haven't used Divvy, but there are racks all over the city to rent it or return it. You can also take a bike on the bus, loaded on the front rack, or on the train if it is not rush hour.

Our neighborhood is on the edge of what used to be an industrial corridor, now transitioning to being used for artsy offices and band practice lofts, breweries and artsy places to have weddings and such. Houses up and down the street are being cleaned up fixed up daily. Whereas it is not a POSH upscale neighborhood, a new private school across the street a couple years ago gave the whole area an upswing, but we can still park free!

expectations: [{'type': 'requires_stairs', 'title': 'Must climb stairs'}]
access:
Guests are welcome throughout the condo.  Everything is accessible with the exception of the other bedroom.

Outside is a small deck, grill, and a table and chairs for entertaining.   Inside, on the first level is a TV and entertainment center.  Netflix, Amazon Prime, a Chromecast, and broadcast channels are available.  Also on the first level is a large stove.

The bedroom itself is on the upper level of the duplex.  It can be accessed in two ways: through the main entrances of the apartment and up the stairs, or separately through the common area.  Both doors have locks.
description:
One room in a lovely duplex up, this is a great place to stay if you're exploring the neighborhoods, or if you want easy access to downtown without the noise and hustle.

Great location! A 5 minute walk from Wicker Park at Division St and Milwaukee Ave, as well as booming Chicago Ave and West Town, and Eckhart Park.

Getting downtown or to other neighborhoods is easy: the Ashland bus is around the corner and the Blue Line 5 minutes away on foot.

Converted to a duplex condo about 15 years ago, there are two bedrooms and one bathroom on the upper level.  The duplex is on the top (third) floor of a multi-unit building (walk-up; no elevator).  On the lower level is a lovely kitchen, large living and outdoor space.  In nice weather, this is an optimal place to have some drinks, grill food, catch some sun and breeze, or just relax.

Regardless of what you are looking for in the city, getting there should not be a problem.  Besides access to public transportation, the duplex is close to several Divvy stations and close to the famous "Hipster Highway", Milwaukee Ave, on which you can get directly to downtown or away from downtown into Wicker Park and Logan Square, or all the way out to O'Hare.

Guests are welcome throughout the condo.  Everything is accessible with the exception of the other bedroom.

Outside is a small deck, grill, and a table and chairs for entertaining.   Inside, on the first level is a TV and entertainment center.  Netflix, Amazon Prime, a Chromecast, and broadcast channels are available.  Also on the first level is a large stove.

The bedroom itself is on the upper level of the duplex.  It can be accessed in two ways: through the main entrances of the apartment and up the stairs, or separately through the common area.  Both doors have locks.

I rent my condo when I am traveling, so I will usually be unavailable for anything that needs personal interaction.  However, I am always willing to answer a call or text with any recommendations, concerns or other issues.

Wicker Park is known for it's shopping, restaurants, coffee shops and nightlife.  

West Town includes Ukranian Village and East Village, and I've been impressed with the sheer quantity of dining options in the area.

Public transportation has you covered:  
The apartment is within walking distance (~5 min) of the Blue Line at Division.  From there, the rest of the city is accessible on the L.  Common destinations from the Blue Line are Logan Square, O'Hare, or the Loop.
Besides trains, just steps outside of the apartment is the Ashland #9 bus, which can take you as far North or South as you need to go.  The Division #70 and Chicago #66 bus lines are both about 5 minutes away as well.

West Town is popular for it's bike lanes, so if you get around on two wheels you are in luck.  Augusta, Division, Milwaukee and Wood are just a few of the nearby streets with good bike lanes.  Divvy bike share has several stations nearby.

You have the entire place to yourself.

additional_house_rules:
We are a smoke free and pet free home. Be respectful of our neighbors and keep the noise level at a minimum.

We insist on a complete profile, so if you are new to airbnb please fill yours out. When you email please tell me a little bit about yourself and your trip. We do live here and have a child, so we want to know who you are. Your photo should be YOU, not your pet, your child or your favorite food.

Airbnb has made changes that us host will not see your photos until the booking is completed.  We want to reiterate that we insist that your photo is clear and visibly you.  When arriving we will be using your profile or guests’ photos to confirm who you are for our safety.  By booking you agree that this is completed.  If this is not completed by the time of the booking, we reserve the right to cancel the reservation at any time.  Please note, we have had hundreds of happy guests that stayed with us over the years.  We just happen to not agree with Airbnb’s new policy to show guest photo’s until after a booking is completed.  For us, this is all about transparency of knowing who we let into our home.

The number of occupancy can not exceed the total number of guests on the reservation, unless pre-approved by the host prior to arrival.  Sorry, our home is not meant for parties for unapproved guests and additional guests sleeping for free is not ok.

There are exterior cameras outside of the units that monitor the front door and backyard patio.

Quite hours are after 10:00 PM. 

When coming and going through the front or rear, please keep the doors locked at all times.

Otherwise my house is your house, enjoy your stay!!

Lost keys: $50 replacement fee (Just don't lose them, and we'll be all good!)

description:
A modern fully furnished apartment in Chicago located in the heart of Logan Square. Offering endless options for dining, entertainment, culture, and transportation all within a walk-able neighborhood. Walk or Train to every site in minutes; PARKING PASSES INCLUDED!

*** We are literally a minute away from the center of Logan Square and Transit. ***

This recently renovated five bedroom apartment consists of a bright and sunny first floor and a garden/in law apartment.  Each floor have their own dedicated entrances for additional privacy.  There are two kitchens and two living rooms area, one with fire a place. 

On the first floor, one of the bedrooms have queen size bed with a baby crib, the second is a queen, and third bedroom have a full size beds.  On the garden floor, there are two bed rooms with comfortable full size beds and a third bonus sleeping area off the living room has a single size bed.  Big living room and dining room on the first floor.  Both kitchen are well equipped with refrigerator, oven/cooktop, microwave, cookware, utensils, and some cooking supplies. Laundry washer and dryer included.

Additional notes for the garden:  Garden level means that the unit is 5 steps below ground level.  Tall people please be aware that the ceiling are basically 7 1/2 feet, with 6 1/2 feet in two small areas that are not located in any of the main spaces.

Only if you like

I love that we have a 24 hour subway station (Logan Square Blue Line) at my doorstep, it's like having your own chauffeur! The best part is, it's underground, so there's no train noises like other places near the transit! There are tons restaurants, bars, coffee shops, movie theater, shopping, farmers market (during summer),  salons, banks, and many more business  all within a block from our home. Not to mention parks and a divvy bike station where you can pick up a bike anytime, and go on the riding trail only a mile away.

Its a straight shot from O'hare airport on the blue line. Its the only one of two lines that operate 24 hrs a day. Its about a 20 minute train ride to our house. From there you only need to cross the street and you are here!! 
From Midway airport, you get on the orange line to the loop and then transfer to the blue line, it takes about 35 minutes. There is also a rent a car station via zip car and enterprise just across the street.
You will never have to worry about traffic coming or going to downtown, which is about 15 minutes on the transit.

Parking Passes:  We do live in a zoned residential parking.  The residential parking number is "96".  This basically applies to all streets that are north and south bound on our block.  Let us know that you have a car(s) and we will leave parking stickers that are good for 24 hours per pass on the dining room table.

There are "external" building security cameras for the front and back porch common building spaces.

access: Guests will have full access to the entire basement of the house. Besides the garden apartment, there is a recreation room with pool table, fireplace and flat screen TV.  There is a sleeper sofa should you want to travel with your family, and we can provide additional mattresses as needed.  You are also welcome to enjoy your morning coffee or sun downer on our front porch, one of the most spectacular porches in Wilmette.  Feel free to use our grill if you wish.  Access to WiFi is included.
description:
English garden apartment in historic Wilmette home with private entrance, sauna, washer/dryer,  kitchenette, dining area, recreation room with pool table, vintage pinball machine and wood burning fireplace with gas igniter.  One queen bed, one full size bed, and 2 sleeper sofas and mattresses available for large families. Ideal access to Northwestern University for all events. Free WIFI and internet enabled flat screen TV.

The garden apartment is newly painted, has a new floor and is ethnically inspired by Helen's South African heritage.  It comes fully equipped with coffee maker, toaster oven, tea kettle, stovetop, refrigerator, and microwave in the kitchenette, and all linens and towels.  Anything else you may need can be borrowed from our kitchen.

Guests will have full access to the entire basement of the house. Besides the garden apartment, there is a recreation room with pool table, fireplace and flat screen TV.  There is a sleeper sofa should you want to travel with your family, and we can provide additional mattresses as needed.  You are also welcome to enjoy your morning coffee or sun downer on our front porch, one of the most spectacular porches in Wilmette.  Feel free to use our grill if you wish.  Access to WiFi is included.

One of us will be home or a phone call away to offer recommendations and information to help you during your visit to Chicago.

Our house is two short blocks away from the Northwestern football stadium, so is an ideal place to stay if you are planning on attending a game.  It has easy train access to all locations around the city.  Wilmette is an old Chicago suburb with brick roads, old trees and squirrels abound. You will wake up to the sound of the birds outside your window.  It is safe, tranquil and close to the beach and the Bahai temple.  There are two grocery stores within easy walking distance as well.

There is ample street parking in front of the house.  We are also a short walk from the Linden Purple line train stop and the Central St in Evanston METRA stop.

The house is within walking distance to the Northwestern football stadium.  For families moving new students into Northwestern, it is just a short drive away.  It is also a short walk to the Linden Purple Line train station and the Central Street, Evanston METRA station.  We do have two small dogs.  They do not have access to the garden apartment.  If you would like to bring a pet, there is an additional $100 pet fee payable upon arrival. Please let us know before you book if you are hoping to bring a pet. No cats allowed.  There is a small pond in the garden that is filled in the summer.  Guests with small children should never lose sight of them if they are out exploring the garden.

access:
Guests have access to the entire unit, it is not shared with anyone else. 

There is paid parking available in front of the building and a parking garages nearby if you have a car.
description:
This newly renovated, luxurious three bedroom loft is located in the heart of Downtown in a safe neighborhood with a lot of restaurants, cafes, and nightlife. It is a quick walk to the Chicago Riverwalk and there is a Red Line L stop steps from the building providing quick & convenient access to explore everything Chicago has to offer! This is a great option for groups looking for a large, luxurious open concept floor plan. And all three bedrooms enjoy beautifully remodeled en suite bathrooms.

This luxury 3 bedroom, 3.5 bathroom loft is over 2,500 square feet and has been beautifully renovated with no detail overlooked. The location also can’t be beat! Located in the heart of downtown and steps from a Red Line L stop allows you to easily access the best of Chicago! The loft has an open concept that is ideal for groups.

The loft is accessed directly from the elevator, which requires a personalized key fob making it both incredibly private and safe. The elevator opens to the expansive living area, which is perfectly arranged in an open concept. The kitchen is amazing - fully-stocked and outfitted with professional grade appliances, quartz countertops, and a large island that provides everything a chef needs to prepare a wonderful meal! The dining table has seating for eight and is a great place to enjoy a home cooked meal or delivery!

The living area is open to the kitchen and dining area and has a wall of windows showcasing the Chicago cityscape. There is a large sectional sofa that provides comfortable seating to enjoy a streamed show or movie on the large screen Smart TV (cable TV is not provided). The rest of the living area has a foosball table and bar.

The three bedrooms are located away from the entertaining area. The first bedroom has a queen size bed, great reading nook, and an en suite bathroom with a shower/tub. The second bedroom has a queen size bed, exposed brick, and an en suite bathroom with a shower. Finally, the master bedroom has a king size bed, his and her closets, and a spacious en suite bathroom with a freestanding tub, steam shower, and double vanities. You will find everything you expect from a master suite and more! For larger groups, we can provide a queen size inflatable mattress, bedding, and pillows.

Guests have access to the entire unit, it is not shared with anyone else. 

There is paid parking available in front of the building and a parking garages nearby if you have a car.

We are off site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by messaging us through the app!

As Chicago's official downtown area, the Loop is one of the most important central business districts on the globe. In addition to its dynamic architecture and buzzing atmosphere, the area has an incredible concentration of cultural institutions, urban park spaces, award-winning restaurants and a shopper's paradise on State Street.

Famous for its striking architecture, the Loop vaunts signature buildings by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe and Louis Henri Sullivan, as well as Aqua by modern day prodigy Jeanne Gang. The area hangout, Millennium Park, complements its surrounding with stunning architectural marvels of its own. The park's crown jewels include a Frank Gehry-designed amphitheater and Cloud Gate, the landmark "Bean" that's become an iconic symbol of Chicago. Nearby Maggie Daley Park and the Chicago Riverwalk are two new engaging outdoor spaces that embrace design — and fun!

Getting around is easy when you're near everything! Since you're nearby all amenities, you can walk to anything you may need.

The Clark/Lake train stop is just a 2 min walk away. This will lead you anywhere in the city.

The highway is also nearby if you are driving. Otherwise, there are plenty of Uber/Lyfts and taxis in this area.

You are in the heart of downtown and right next to the train! Although our windows are as soundproof as possible, please be aware that you may notice the normal sounds of city life.  

Parking is limited around the area. We recommend walking, taking the train or traveling via Uber/Lyft or taxi. If you absolutely need more parking, you can try using one of the many parking spot apps such as SpotHero.

additional_house_rules:
1. AGREEMENT:
The Owner, and guest(s) agree as follows: Guest(s) is an adult (over 18 years old) and will be the sole occupant(s) of the rental space. Use of the rental space and building premises is only for the individuals disclosed prior to arrival in the communication platform within the booking source: www.airbnb.com. The vacation rental booking is not transferable to a 3rd party.

2. NO SMOKING POLICY: (smoke outdoor only)
The Owner is committed to providing a safe, healthy, and pleasant communal environment for all guests. Smoking of any forms (such as cigarettes, cigars, hookah, etc.) is prohibited inside of our building. Guest(s) are welcome to smoke outdoors. Guest(s) who violates this policy are subject to immediate removal from the property without refund. The violator(s) may be charged a SMOKE CLEANING fee of up to $700.

3. DRUG POLICY: The Owner prohibits possession, use, or distribution of unlawful drugs. 

4. NEIGHBORHOOD NOISE POLICY:
Guest(s) agree to behavior acceptable for noise in and around the rental space. Guest(s) agree to quiet, considerate and respectful behavior that would not disturb any neighbors. Loud partying, even inside the rented space, is prohibited.

5. CLEANING:
The Owner operates a self-catering vacation rental. Guest(s) are expected to pick up after themselves before departure. The cleaning fee included in the charge at the time of booking does not include extraordinary cleaning such as doing entire meal dishes, scraping burnt pots and pans, cleaning burnt oven and stove tops, cleaning mud in the interior space, cleaning crayons and other scuff mark on walls, etc. These extreme cleaning required may be considered property damage and subject to security deposit withholding.

6. PET POLICY:
Guest(s) understand that The Owner does not accept animals of any kind inside the building. 

7. SAFE AND HARMONIOUS COMMUNITY POLICY:
Guest(s) are expected to behave courteously to the neighborhood community. Guest(s) who disrupts peace and creates tension with neighbors may be removed from the property under the laws governing transient vacation rental businesses. The Owner reserves the right to refuse service to individual(s) who pose the risk of harm to themselves and others. Individual(s) who exhibits verbal or physical threats, psychological imbalance, odd behavior that threaten safety and peace of the community will be removed. If difficulties arise then local law enforcement will be called for intervention and criminal charges may be filed.

8. GUESTS LIABILITY:
Guest(s) agree to accept liability for any damages caused to the property (other than normal wear and tear) by guest(s), including, but not limited to bed, mattress, misuse of appliances and furnishing, and linens. Guest(s) agrees to reimburse The Owner for costs incurred to repair/replace damaged items that may exceed above and beyond the security deposit withheld during the booking

9. WAIVER OF CLAIMS, RELEASE, INDEMNITY, AND HOLD HARMLESS:
Guest(s) understands that the space being rented is a transient vacation rental unit. It's defining characteristic is the rental is for less than 30 consecutive days. Guest(s) acknowledges that staying in vacation rentals managed by the Owner is wholly voluntary. The Owner does not assume any liability for loss, damage or injury to persons or their personal property, and does not warrant or guarantee the safety of Guest(s). Guest(s) agrees to report any hazardous conditions that may cause damage or injury to person or their property. Guest(s) understand the Owner does not accept liability or any loss or damage caused by weather conditions, natural disasters, acts of God, or other reasons beyond its control. Guest is assuming full responsibility for choosing to stay at the vacation rental property.

10. ADDITIONAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS:
By booking, the undersigned, for himself/herself, his/her heirs, assigners, executors, and administrators, fully releases and discharges The Owner from any and all claims, demands and causes of action by reason of any injury or whatever nature which has or have occurred, or may occur to the undersigned, or any of his/her guests as a result of, or in connection with the occupancy of the premises and agrees to hold The Owner free and harmless of any claim or suit arising therefrom. In any action concerning the rights, duties or liabilities of the parties to this agreement, their principals, agents, successors or assignees the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover reasonable attorney fees and costs.

description:
Stay in a Logan Square coachhouse! It is a guest-house with 2 beds and 2.5 baths spread out over two levels. It includes a full kitchen, two porches, dining room, TV, WIFI, and everything you need to enjoy your time in Chicago!

It's a renovated, 2 level home with great architectural features, including an open staircase and incredible light!

Logan Square is a fantastic neighborhood along the Blue Line in Chicago. It hosts some of the best cocktail bars alongside your classic dive bars, with diners and restaurants to please the pickiest foodies. Don't forget to check out shopping and nightlife on Milwaukee Avenue, catch a film at Logan Theater, or just relax on the boulevard!

The closest train stop is the Blue Line El which is an 16 minute walk. Or you can take the Fullerton Bus (#74) which drops you off near the California Stop. Lyft and Uber are great ways to get around the city and are usually only a few minutes away!

No parties, events, or group get-togethers are permitted. No outside guests beyond those listed on the reservation are allowed on property at any time. The property is monitored via a security camera. Violation of these terms will lead to immediate eviction of all guests from property.
house_rules:
1. AGREEMENT:
The Owner, and guest(s) agree as follows: Guest(s) is an adult (over 18 years old) and will be the sole occupant(s) of the rental space. Use of the rental space and building premises is only for the individuals disclosed prior to arrival in the communication platform within the booking source: www.airbnb.com. The vacation rental booking is not transferable to a 3rd party.

2. NO SMOKING POLICY: (smoke outdoor only)
The Owner is committed to providing a safe, healthy, and pleasant communal environment for all guests. Smoking of any forms (such as cigarettes, cigars, hookah, etc.) is prohibited inside of our building. Guest(s) are welcome to smoke outdoors. Guest(s) who violates this policy are subject to immediate removal from the property without refund. The violator(s) may be charged a SMOKE CLEANING fee of up to $700.

3. DRUG POLICY: The Owner prohibits possession, use, or distribution of unlawful drugs. 

4. NEIGHBORHOOD NOISE POLICY:
Guest(s) agree to behavior acceptable for noise in and around the rental space. Guest(s) agree to quiet, considerate and respectful behavior that would not disturb any neighbors. Loud partying, even inside the rented space, is prohibited.

5. CLEANING:
The Owner operates a self-catering vacation rental. Guest(s) are expected to pick up after themselves before departure. The cleaning fee included in the charge at the time of booking does not include extraordinary cleaning such as doing entire meal dishes, scraping burnt pots and pans, cleaning burnt oven and stove tops, cleaning mud in the interior space, cleaning crayons and other scuff mark on walls, etc. These extreme cleaning required may be considered property damage and subject to security deposit withholding.

6. PET POLICY:
Guest(s) understand that The Owner does not accept animals of any kind inside the building. 

7. SAFE AND HARMONIOUS COMMUNITY POLICY:
Guest(s) are expected to behave courteously to the neighborhood community. Guest(s) who disrupts peace and creates tension with neighbors may be removed from the property under the laws governing transient vacation rental businesses. The Owner reserves the right to refuse service to individual(s) who pose the risk of harm to themselves and others. Individual(s) who exhibits verbal or physical threats, psychological imbalance, odd behavior that threaten safety and peace of the community will be removed. If difficulties arise then local law enforcement will be called for intervention and criminal charges may be filed.

8. GUESTS LIABILITY:
Guest(s) agree to accept liability for any damages caused to the property (other than normal wear and tear) by guest(s), including, but not limited to bed, mattress, misuse of appliances and furnishing, and linens. Guest(s) agrees to reimburse The Owner for costs incurred to repair/replace damaged items that may exceed above and beyond the security deposit withheld during the booking

9. WAIVER OF CLAIMS, RELEASE, INDEMNITY, AND HOLD HARMLESS:
Guest(s) understands that the space being rented is a transient vacation rental unit. It's defining characteristic is the rental is for less than 30 consecutive days. Guest(s) acknowledges that staying in vacation rentals managed by the Owner is wholly voluntary. The Owner does not assume any liability for loss, damage or injury to persons or their personal property, and does not warrant or guarantee the safety of Guest(s). Guest(s) agrees to report any hazardous conditions that may cause damage or injury to person or their property. Guest(s) understand the Owner does not accept liability or any loss or damage caused by weather conditions, natural disasters, acts of God, or other reasons beyond its control. Guest is assuming full responsibility for choosing to stay at the vacation rental property.

10. ADDITIONAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS:
By booking, the undersigned, for himself/herself, his/her heirs, assigners, executors, and administrators, fully releases and discharges The Owner from any and all claims, demands and causes of action by reason of any injury or whatever nature which has or have occurred, or may occur to the undersigned, or any of his/her guests as a result of, or in connection with the occupancy of the premises and agrees to hold The Owner free and harmless of any claim or suit arising therefrom. In any action concerning the rights, duties or liabilities of the parties to this agreement, their principals, agents, successors or assignees the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover reasonable attorney fees and costs.
neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is a fantastic neighborhood along the Blue Line in Chicago. It hosts some of the best cocktail bars alongside your classic dive bars, with diners and restaurants to please the pickiest foodies. Don't forget to check out shopping and nightlife on Milwaukee Avenue, catch a film at Logan Theater, or just relax on the boulevard!
notes: No parties, events, or group get-togethers are permitted. No outside guests beyond those listed on the reservation are allowed on property at any time. The property is monitored via a security camera. Violation of these terms will lead to immediate eviction of all guests from property.
space: It's a renovated, 2 level home with great architectural features, including an open staircase and incredible light!
summary: Stay in a Logan Square coachhouse! It is a guest-house with 2 beds and 2.5 baths spread out over two levels. It includes a full kitchen, two porches, dining room, TV, WIFI, and everything you need to enjoy your time in Chicago!
transit: The closest train stop is the Blue Line El which is an 16 minute walk. Or you can take the Fullerton Bus (#74) which drops you off near the California Stop. Lyft and Uber are great ways to get around the city and are usually only a few minutes away!

access: Laundry in basement.
description:
Cozy, comfortable and secure private apartment with living room, work space, 2 bedroom, kitchen and 1 bath. 

Ideal location. Next to Chicago CTA blue line western location. 

Experience Chicago like a local. Best neighborhood in the city with everything right at your finger tips. 

No pets allowed

Large private apartment in one-the-best locations in the city! 

Kitchen includes the basics. The living area has a comfortable sofa and work space. The bedrooms are quiet and cozy bedroom. The bathroom has shower and the basics for your travel. 

The entire city is at your fingertips with easy access to the city CTA blue line. Approximately 5 stops to the loop.

Laundry in basement.

I live nearby and am available to answer all your questions. However I understand a guests need for privacy.

Located next to Chicago’s subway. The station is the “Western” blue line. Easy access to O’Hare and downtown. 
Located in at the cross section of Historic Wicker Park/Bucktown/Logan Square neighborhoods with Humbolt Park located nearby. 
Wicker Park/Bucktown is filled with trendy restaurants, boutiques and local drinking places. A beautiful neighborhood with historic homes, condominiums, parks and easy access to the “606” five mile bike/walking trail.  
Divvy bikes and zip cars are all within a few steps from the front door. 

Literally the best spot in city.

Easy access to Divvy bikes. Zip cars. Uber. Taxis. 

If you have a car, street parking is available.

No pets allowed. No more that 2 guests are allowed in this unit without prior approval

additional_house_rules:
House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.
7.) Please put away all patio cushions if they were used during your stay.

access: You'll have full access to my 2 bedroom, 2 bath home with private terrace.
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 10% off OR 30+ at 15% off! 

Our bright modern 2 bedroom condo has 13 ft ceilings & an amazing private terrace.  It's in the heart of Old Town, right on Wells St - steps outside the door are some of the city's best restaurants, cafes, & bars. Just a 5 minute walk to two world-renowned comedy clubs: Second City & Zanies. The Chicago History Museum, Lincoln Park Zoo, & the lake are a quick walk too. The Sedgwick CTA stop is nearby too!

You'll walk into an open kitchen / living / dining space - just off the dining room, french doors lead to the private terrace. Off the dining area, we have a bedroom with two Twin-sized beds (and its own door to the terrace!) A hallway off the living room leads to a full-bath, as well as the master suite with ensuite bath.

You'll have full access to my 2 bedroom, 2 bath home with private terrace.

From artsy to affluent, this historic neighborhood has been home to many disparate groups over the years. An incredibly popular neighborhood destination, largely because of its proximity to the lake and downtown, Old Town keeps up a lively pace day and night. Victorian-era buildings, brick alleyways and narrow, tree-lined streets are charming backdrops to a busy main strip that runs along Wells Street between North Avenue and Division Street.

We have an outstanding "walk score" of 98!
My place is 5 minutes' walk away from the Sedgwick Brown/Purple line train station, and equally convenient to the North Ave. and LaSalle buses - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here! If you do bring your car, however, it's pretty easy to find garage parking around the condo.

The building shares a wall with a gym - you may hear a class happening in the hallway, but not in our home.

access: Private bedroom on same level as shared bathroom. Bathroom is shared with only one person (the host) and your schedule will be accommodated.
description:
Sunny second floor bedroom on quiet residential tree-lined street. The house is 1 mile from downtown Highland Park and 1/2 mile from Highwood. Great restaurants, coffee shops, library, shopping. The lake is a short walk away with a dog beach. There is room for 3 people in 2 beds. You are welcome to share my kitchen, living room and TV room.

My house was built in late 1920s and has been in my husband's family from that time on. Lots of windows; hardwood floors.

The guest room is sunny and fairly spacious. When 3 guests are staying, a long stay would get very cramped but it's pleasant for overnight.

Private bedroom on same level as shared bathroom. Bathroom is shared with only one person (the host) and your schedule will be accommodated.

I am inclined to welcome my guests and give them all the privacy they desire. Most people who stay have an agenda and are self-motivated. On the other hand if you have questions about the community or how to get somewhere I am happy to help. 

I think both guests and hosts have an interest in knowing something about the other party and I'm always happy to get to know you better if time permits.

Highland Park is a very quiet residential suburb north of Chicago. My home is 2 blocks from Lake Michigan and there are several ways you can enjoy the lake all within very short walking distance. 

We are 1 mile from Highland Park's main business district and 1/2 mile to Highwood. Both towns have access to commuter train to Chicago.

This is a very safe and welcoming community so you will never feel endangered in any way.

You can park your vehicle in my driveway. Metra trains and Pace buses in walking distance give you access to adjoining towns as well as to Chicago. Uber and Lyft also available.

Limited kitchen access is available by pre-arrangement.
house_rules: Quiet time after 10 pm

access: A private patio and garage parking for 1 car are included.
description:
This condo is located in one of the hottest neighborhoods in Chicago. Restaurants, Sports Bars, Live Music, Comedy Clubs, Shopping, Wrigley Field, Blue Man Group at Briar Street Theatre and Lake Michigan are all within very short walking distances!

4 bedroom 3 bath condo in a 4 unit building. 1st floor unit, 2 level, duplex down. Sleeps 8. New construction, high-end finishes, 3-50 inch and 3-40 inch HD plasma TVs, chef's kitchen with Viking appliances, steam bath, surround sound, Comcast cable and high speed internet, private patio, superb location, 3 blocks from Wrigley Field, 2 blocks from El train, 4 blocks from Lake Michigan on tree-lined street. 1 garage parking spot included.  Price includes 16.4% tax.


A private patio and garage parking for 1 car are included.

You will meet my property manager at the condo when you check in.  He and I will be available if you have questions or concerns during your stay.

This condo is located in one of the hottest neighborhoods in Chicago. Restaurants, Sports Bars, Live Music, Comedy Clubs, Shopping, Wrigley Field, Blue Man Group at Briar Street Theatre and Lake Michigan are all within very short walking distances! Wrigley Field is only a 3 block walk! A 10 minute train ride will bring you to Cellular Field for White Sox games.  Lincoln Park Zoo is free and a wonderful walk along the lake! 

The El (train) is 3 blocks west.  Bus and cab service right outside the condo.  1 garage parking space is included.  

Included: Toiletries (soap, shampoo, conditioner), hair dryer, iron/ironing board, dish and laundry detergent, coffee maker and coffee, some seasonings, paper products License #2283377

access: Guests will have a separate back entrance with a code to get in.
description:
Located right in the heart of Wicker Park a short walk from the Damon Blue Line stop and the six corners. We are right off Milwaukee Ave- which is full of cool shops, restaurants, cafés and bars. 

The bedroom looks and feels like a hotel, only cooler cause it's in a dope house  ;D. You will have access to the fully furnished balconies, etc. 

The bathroom is right around the corner from the bedroom.

The space is modern, new, and well furnished. As hosts, we are very welcoming and enjoy meeting cool new people.

This listing does not include parties or other guests- if you want a party you can book it separately.

Guests will have a separate back entrance with a code to get in.

You will likely not even see us much as the house is large and we are busy people. But if you do, we are very friendly and enjoy hanging out with our guests if they want to.

The house is on a quiet street- just one block from being in the middle of all the great restaurants, shopping, and nightlife in Wicker Park!

Very close to the Blue line- which is one of the quickest and easiest ways of getting to and from o'Hare international Airport and downtown.

For your safety and security, there are smoke alarms,  fire extinguishers, and CO2 detectors throughout as well as a security system with cameras in the common spaces on the main floor.  There is also a first aid kit that available.

additional_house_rules:
- Smoking is not allowed anywhere on my property, inside or out. $500 fee will be charged from security deposit if any smoking takes place. 
- Presence of more than 8 people at the property is UNLAWFUL.
- Absolutely no illegal activity will be tolerated. If these rules are not observed, authorities will be notified immediately.
-City of Chicago requires hosts to identify all guests. Each guest will need to present ID at check in and copy will be made. For one day reservations the entire group needs to be present in order to check in.
- This is a neighborhood residential street. All noise needs to remain inside the unit and quite hours observed.

description:
Walk to almost everything Chicago has to offer: Downtown and Magnificent mile; restaurants, bars, boutiques and nightlife of Gold Coast and Old Town; Lincoln Park and North ave beach from this garden level two bedroom apartment on a quiet neighborhood street in the heart of historic Old Town. 
Parking, back yard, washer and dryer, pets welcome- what else can you possibly need?
Everything is done to make your stay comfortable and to accommodate your needs.

You will have the use of the whole floor, which is a lower level two bedroom apartment. It has its own entrance from the street and no internal connection to upper floors.
THE SPACE:
You enter into a large living/dining room combo followed by compact kitchen and full bathroom. Kitchen has a stove, oven, microwave, refrigerator. It is fully stocked if you wish to cook, host or just eat take out from real silverware and dishware.  Two bedrooms are towards the back of the house with exit to amazing backyard with a grill from one of them. One has two queen beds, the other one has one. Living room futons open up and can be used as double beds. 
OTHER AMENITIES:
There is a washer and dryer in the kitchen. The unit has air conditioning and central heat. Please note that I rent the space upstairs and someone might be staying there. Please be aware that you might potentially hear them as well. There is a detached garage and you will have use of one parking space in it. It is a standard residential garage so please plan size of your vehicle accordingly. Free Wifi throughout the property.

Link to all of my properties: http://airbnb.com/p/chr

You will be able to utilize these entire floor, one space in the garage, back yard maybe shared with whoever is staying upstairs.

I have a Superhost status on Airbnb. You can book my property with confidence knowing so many before you truly enjoy their stay and left five star feedback. You can be assured the place will look exactly like the pictures, all amenities will be as described and I am always around to help with anything needed.

The house is in east Old Town- best neighborhood in Chicago for both families or if you are looking to have fun. While the street itself is very quiet, tree lined and barely has cars passing by, as soon as you turn the corner, you are in the center of everything! Wells street restaurants and bars are steps away. Lincoln Park with the zoo, farm, pond, open spaces and farmers market is a 7-10 min. walk. North avenue beach is the same distance. It is perfect for walks, picnics, boat rides or good old fun in the sand. The beaches are free to the public and have breathtaking city views. Grocery shopping is made easy, seeing as Plum Market, Treasure Island and Jewel are located right in the neighborhood. Nearby coffee shops include a 24 hour Starbucks and La Fournette. There are 103 restaurants within a 15 minute walk including some of Chicago's top restaurants including Kamehachi, Topo Gigio, The Fireplace Inn, and Woodies Flat. Bars and lounges are abundant on Wells and are all 1-2 minute walk. Shopping in Old Town is a unique experience; the majority of shops in this neighborhood are boutiques rather than well-known chain stores. Therefore, each and every store is cozy, intimate and filled with one-of-a-kind goods. The Lincoln Park Zoo is a world of wildlife in the shadow of skyscrapers. The Second City only two blocks away and it is a famous theater that specializes in sketch comedy and improv, and has been delighting audiences for over 50 years. Oak street and beginning of Michigan avenue is about 15-20 minute walk.

The house is a six minute walk from the Brown Line and the Purple Line at the Sedgwick stop and an eight minute walk from Red line at Clark. It takes be about 15 min to walk to Michigan Ave and Wells street bars are a minute away. Buses and cabs are also easily accessible. It is about a 3 minute drive to get onto Lake Shore drive at LaSalle and about 8 minutes to Kennedy expressway at North Avenue

IF YOU ARE PLANNING ON HAVING A CELEBRATION: Unregistered guests are not allowed on the property even if they are just visiting and not spending the night. Presence of more than 8 guests is unlawful. A guest is anyone at the property, staying the night or just visiting. There is a counter installed and police will be notified immediately. This is not a place for a local house party. 

CONSIDER PURCHASING MY WORRY FREE CLEANING PACKAGE: For those of you traveling to Chicago to celebrate together: for additional $50 you do not have to clean anything. Just walk out in the morning (you do need to move furniture back if you make any changes to lay out). Note that this fee is additional to my regular cleaning fee.

The brown line train is nearby and you can hear it in some parts of the house. It has never been an issue for any of my tenants however please keep it in mind.
house_rules:
- Smoking is not allowed anywhere on my property, inside or out. $500 fee will be charged from security deposit if any smoking takes place. 
- Presence of more than 8 people at the property is UNLAWFUL.
- Absolutely no illegal activity will be tolerated. If these rules are not observed, authorities will be notified immediately.
-City of Chicago requires hosts to identify all guests. Each guest will need to present ID at check in and copy will be made. For one day reservations the entire group needs to be present in order to check in.
- This is a neighborhood residential street. All noise needs to remain inside the unit and quite hours observed.

description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this stylish South Loop furnished studio apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and roomy living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI185)

Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this studio apartment. Ideally located in Chicago, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this studio apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Swimming Pool
- Gym
- Sauna/Steam Room
- Indoor Parking
- Roof Deck
- Media Room

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in South Loop. A dynamic neighborhood with a unique mix of attractions, shopping and history. Take a stroll along South Michigan Avenue and the nearby Prairie Avenue district to see "Millionaire's Row", an area lined with mansions belonging to Chicago's wealthiest elite. For shopping, visit the Roosevelt Collection, an open-air plaza, home to a cinema as well as premium local and national retailers. Along the southern edge, you will find Soldier Field, the Chicago Bears football stadium. Don’t miss the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum and Grant Park, all adjacent to one another and huge attractions in South Loop.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details

additional_house_rules:
Treat our home like yours - be respectful and honor the fact that you are our guest - not a mere tenant at a hotel!
In order to make it easy we made some basic information for you.
PLEASE REVIEW. 
1) No smoking.
2) No pets.
3) Please no shoes once upstairs. We provide booties if you need them.
4) No parties with loud music.
5) No unauthorized guests.  If are inviting guests, please let us know prior.
6) Please do not lose your keys - there will be an extra charge of $60 for all lost keys.

GOVERNMENT-ISSUED PHOTO ID IS REQUIRED FOR CHECK-IN. This is extremely important, and there is zero tolerance. If you do not have an ID, you will NOT be able to check-in, and you will NOT be refunded.

This property is NOT AVAILABLE for any commercial or student project purposes, including, but not limited to, filming, photography, other advertising, and subletting by the guest. You may not host any commercial event in our places; meetings may be exempt. Please do not ask if you can film video or hold photo shoots at my place; no, you may not. Violators will be asked to leave.

access: The accommodation is the whole upper floor, (one short flight of stairs) and you have your own entrance. Enjoy a luxurious home away from home.
description:
Enjoy charismatic Chicago in a lovely, very private sunlit home that is both stylish and large. Fab decor, full amenities and an open-plan layout invites you to enjoy quiet elegant comfort of home.  Free parking and easy walk to Wrigley Field. Take the bus or train downtown.  Easy walk to wine & dine in posh areas of Roscoe Village, Lake view & Lincoln Square.

This is A FULL UPPER FLOOR, and NOT a Garden Basement. You are a short walk away from restaurants, stores but stay in a quiet  beautifully appointed 1100 square feet elegant 1 large Bedroom flat with parking all to yourself. 
Enjoy this -its hard to find in this city.
Refurbished to the highest standards this spacious apartment is located moments from shopping, restaurants and pubs in the heart of cool Roscoe Village Lakeview & Lincoln square neighborhoods of Chicago.
Famously eclectic and vibrant, we are the heart of Chicago's best offerings. Boyztown, Buck town, Lincoln park or music at Scubas, Stage 777, Revolution Brewery, and other cool hip spots  are a short walk or ride away. 
Home of the CUBS -Chicago’s best attractions  "Walking to Wrigley field with all of the other "fans" singing GO CUBS was a fab experience" a guest's comment.  
The most difficult decision of the day might well be whether to eat out - many restaurants, pubs and bars in the area catering for all tastes and pockets; or to stay in and cook - cozy comfort of a first class home. 
We are keen for you to enjoy your stay with us, and we will do our best to make your stay a memorable one.

The accommodation is the whole upper floor, (one short flight of stairs) and you have your own entrance. Enjoy a luxurious home away from home.

You have an entire floor to yourself with 100% privacy. Interaction with our guest is as much or as little as you need, when we are in town.
We often travel, but always have a caretaker who will be responsible to ensure satisfaction for your complete stay.

Part of the area's charm is not only the elegant vintage Chicago style homes, or how easy it is to walk to all the local favorite dining, but how much personality all the small independent businesses on Roscoe street have. This gives the neighborhood a hip vibe and friendly, small-town feel!

Centrally located in the middle of Wrigleville, Lakeview, Bucktown, Logan Square, Lincoln Square and 10 minutes to train station - 5 minutes to bus or divvy bikes. Or park your car FREE - a luxury in Chicago

Centrally located, yet quiet and charming you will be within minutes of everything this mega city has to offer. 
Chicago is a major city second only to New York, in the United States, and is a global alpha city with fantastic offerings. This glittering city built on the shores of Lake Michigan is where you’ll find some of the biggest and best entertainment outside of New York City and Las Vegas, including touring Broadway shows, professional sports teams, stand-up comedy and concert venues – including the iconic Chicago Theater and Grant Park, home of Lollapalooza. The second city is also home to year-round attractions and world-class museums – the Field Museum, the Skydeck at the Willis Tower, Shedd Aquarium, and the Art Institute of Chicago.

Chicago sports fans fuel their passion year-round as they cheer on the north side Cubs or south side White Sox in the summer, Bulls and Blackhawks in the winter, and Bears in the fall.
house_rules:
Treat our home like yours - be respectful and honor the fact that you are our guest - not a mere tenant at a hotel!
In order to make it easy we made some basic information for you.
PLEASE REVIEW. 
1) No smoking.
2) No pets.
3) Please no shoes once upstairs. We provide booties if you need them.
4) No parties with loud music.
5) No unauthorized guests.  If are inviting guests, please let us know prior.
6) Please do not lose your keys - there will be an extra charge of $60 for all lost keys.

GOVERNMENT-ISSUED PHOTO ID IS REQUIRED FOR CHECK-IN. This is extremely important, and there is zero tolerance. If you do not have an ID, you will NOT be able to check-in, and you will NOT be refunded.

This property is NOT AVAILABLE for any commercial or student project purposes, including, but not limited to, filming, photography, other advertising, and subletting by the guest. You may not host any commercial event in our places; meetings may be exempt. Please do not ask if you can film video or hold photo shoots at my place; no, you may not. Violators will be asked to leave.

additional_house_rules:
- No parties allowed. Please remove shoes inside the apartment. Please specify the number of guests when booking our place. No visitors are allowed in the apartment. If you have someone picking you up or dropping you off, they may help you with your luggage, but no extensive visits please. Thank you for understanding. 

Welcome to our place. 

Safety:
The closest hospital with Emergency Room is Thorek Memorial hospital located at 
850 W Irving Park Rd. 
Chicago, IL 60613
Hospital Phone: (773) 525-6780

Please reach out to us through the AirBnB Messaging function within the app. It’s the best method to use to contact us. If there is an emergency or you cannot use the app for some reason please call us at 773-366-4825. That number is voice-only. We cannot use text messaging without using the AirBnB Messaging app. This is for our mutual protection and safety. If a text message is directed to the phone number provided we will copy the message to the AirBnB Messaging platform and then answer your query there.
As a Superhost, we aim to make your stay as comfortable as it can possibly be! And we want to help our guests create beautiful memories in our cozy studio. For us to do so, we would truly appreciate it if you can follow these house rules and confirm that they have been reviewed WITHIN 48 HOURS OF YOUR BOOKING. Thank you in advance and truly appreciate your cooperation!

- Check-in after 3pm. 
   Check-out before 11am. 
- No shoes inside the apartment. You can bring slippers to walk inside the apartment.
- Keep noise to a minimum after 10pm.
- There shall not be smoking inside the apartment. Extra cleaning fees to remove odor and stains may be applied.
- Please wash your dishes after use. If dishes are not washed, extra cleaning fees may be applied.
- PARKING: You need a permit to park on our street 6pm to 6am, I can provide parking permits if you let me know ahead if you need them and provided there’s any parking available on our street, it’s harder to find parking spots after 6-7 pm, but you can park on Gordon terrace, which is just one block north of Belle Plaine, on Broadway between Cuyler and Montrose, and on Sheridan between Cuyler and Montrose for free. Just please observe all restrictions and signs, like street cleaning, etc.
- No parties or visitors allowed, except for to help you with your luggage. Our place is only to be used by the number of registered guests and is not to invite others to the apartment as it will be considered as hosting a party.
 - If guests are found to have had a party without host permission which results in extra cleaning, guests will be responsible for extra cleaning charges and in the unfortunate event of the disruptions alerting neighbors, GUESTS WILL BE ASKED TO VACATE THE PROPERTY IMMEDIATELY.
- If guests are suspected of carrying and/or using illegal drugs of any kind, the authorities will be engaged, and GUESTS WILL BE ASKED TO VACATE THE PROPERTY IMMEDIATELY.
- Please acknowledge that from occasionally, we may leave consumables such as condiments or snacks left behind by previous guests if they are not empty. We try our very best to ensure that it is not expired or stale. HOWEVER, ultimately, it is up to the guests' discretion and inspection to consume these items if they wish.  The host does not take any responsibility for the consumables.
- Please do not rearrange our furniture.
- Lastly, because this is an Airbnb community not a hotel, and is also our apartment, please be respectful of the property and keep it clean before you leave. (Respect our property and our things)
If you have read it this far, THANK YOU for being a SUPER GUEST! Please reply back with my favourite quote: "EXPECT NOTHING, APPRECIATE EVERYTHING." so that I know that the house rules have been reviewed.

description:
Large, bright, well-loved studio apartment with full kitchen and 1 bathroom. Wi-Fi, NETFLIX, PRIME VIDEO, YOUTUBE. Queen size bed and queen size sofa-sleeper. Minutes from Wrigley Field(about 10-15 minutes walk), Red line to Downtown, walking distance to Lake Michigan and the beach. Michael’s Pizzeria and bar, GNS Grocery/Liquor Store across the street, Target, Jewel osco, Aldi, Ross stores two blocks away and so many more attractions. The apartment is on the top-third floor and is very quiet.

Spacious studio over 450 square feet with full kitchen and 1 bathroom

All access

I am the property manager at the building and usually available during the day. You can call or text me during normal work hours, unless it’s an emergency

Quiet, safe and friendly neighborhood with plenty options for shopping, restaurants and  other entertainment

You need a permit to park on our street 6pm to 6am, I can provide parking permits if you let me know ahead if you need them and provided there’s any parking available on our street, it’s harder to find parking spots after 6-7 pm, but you can park on Gordon terrace, which is just one block north of Belle Plaine, on Broadway between Cuyler and Montrose, and on Sheridan between Cuyler and Montrose for free. Just please observe all restrictions and signs, like street cleaning, etc.

Please use Guest profile while watching Netflix

additional_house_rules:
1) Smoking and vaping are only allowed on your private balcony with the balcony door shut. The rest of the property is smoke and vapor free. We have marijuana and tobacco chemical sensors on the property. They know it's not cooking smoke, They react to airborne particulate, not the smell on your clothes. The PolySens® technology works, so exit the building if you want to smoke/vape or you'll be fined $500 and asked to leave.

2) Your reservation has paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number, whether visiting or sleeping, you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first.

3) Quiet hours are 10PM-8AM. Noise should not be heard coming from your apartment. This is a quiet residential building. 95% of our guests have no issues, and never hear from us. We will be sure to send you at least 2 warnings prior to asking anyone to leave, but one way or another, the apartment must be quiet.

4) Parties, events, and commercial activity are not allowed.

5) We reserve the right to ask you to leave without a refund if any of the above rules are broken.

6) Lost keys will incur a $100 charge. We have to change the locks. Please use the app to send a picture of all the keys at check-in AND check-out.

7) Our favorite restaurant in Chicago is La Scarola.


Privacy Statement on the Use of Security Cameras:
We respect and value the privacy of our guests. We will never place a camera inside a living space. While Airbnb policy allows cameras in spaces that are not used for sleeping or bathing, we disagree. Cameras should be banned from inside all living spaces. Footage should be automatically deleted. Everything should be disclosed in advance. We use hallway security cameras to verify the number of guests who have entered an apartment. This is useful for stopping parties, and under additional prices extra guest charges may apply for extra people sleeping over.  All footage is deleted automatically after a stay, unless there is an open resolution center case. It’s unfortunate that not every guest is honest about their intentions, and our community would not allow us to be on Airbnb if we did not prevent unwanted behaviors. Let us know if you have questions. We have nothing to hide.
name: Blue Line Luxury w/ GYM & SKYLINE VIEWS ROOF (G)
